title: High Primary Education Enrollment for Females
description: In 2018, Sierra Leone achieved a gross intake ratio of 175.71% for females in the first grade of primary education, indicating a strong emphasis on female education.

title: Significant Diarrhea Treatment Coverage
description: As of 2019, 85.3% of children under five in Sierra Leone received oral rehydration salts for diarrhea treatment, showcasing effective healthcare interventions.

title: Severe Food Insecurity Prevalence
description: In 2022, 88.6% of Sierra Leone's population experienced moderate or severe food insecurity, highlighting a critical area of concern.

title: Low Fixed Telephone Subscription Rate
description: In 2022, Sierra Leone had only 0.00325 fixed telephone subscriptions per 100 people, indicating limited telecommunication infrastructure.

title: Minimal Industry Value Added Per Worker
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in Sierra Leone's industry sector was $980.52, reflecting challenges in industrial productivity.

title: Limited Social Insurance Coverage
description: In 2018, only 16.55% of Sierra Leone's second quintile population was covered by social insurance programs, indicating gaps in social protection.

title: High Gross Intake Ratio in Primary Education
description: In 2018, Sierra Leone's gross intake ratio for the first grade of primary education was 171.85%, reflecting strong educational enrollment efforts.

title: Low Secondary Income from Other Sectors
description: In 2023, Sierra Leone's secondary income from other sectors was $4,361.18, indicating limited economic diversification.

title: Minimal Primary Income Receipts
description: Sierra Leone's primary income receipts were $25,949.08 in 2023, suggesting limited earnings from abroad.

title: Low Bilateral Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2015, Sierra Leone received $9,999.99 in net bilateral aid from Luxembourg, reflecting limited international financial support.
